title: Add Google Analytics tag (G-73VJ1TQ3D7) to all pages

requirements.text: Inject the Google Analytics gtag.js snippet (tracking ID: G-73VJ1TQ3D7) into the application so it loads on every page. Place the two <script> tags immediately after the opening <head> tag in frontend/index.html. Ensure only one Google tag is present — do not duplicate it if one already exists.

quotes: paste it in the code of every page of your website, immediately after the <head> element. Don't add more than one Google tag to each page.

acceptanceCriteria: The gtag.js script tag with src 'https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtag/js?id=G-73VJ1TQ3D7' appears as the first child of <head> in frontend/index.html.
The inline gtag configuration script (dataLayer, gtag('config', 'G-73VJ1TQ3D7')) follows immediately after the async gtag.js script tag.
No duplicate Google tag scripts exist anywhere in frontend/index.html.

All pages of the app (Home, Destinations, Packages, PlanTrip, Contact, Community, Admin, AdminLogin, DestinationDetail) load the Google Analytics tag since they all use the single index.html entry point.

constraints: Only one Google tag (G-73VJ1TQ3D7) must appear in the HTML — remove any existing gtag snippet before inserting the new one to avoid duplicates.
Do not modify any files listed in frontend.immutablePaths.
nonGoals: Adding Google Analytics to individual page components or route-level hooks.
Implementing custom event tracking beyond the base gtag configuration.
